*div1 type="summary"* *p*Francis Smith to Austin, Tenoxtitlan; August 22, 1832. Troops abandoning the place and going to Bexar. Much danger from Indians.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Tenoxtitlan */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="08-22-1832">Aug. 22nd 1832*/date_mentioned*.*/p* *p*Sir.*/p*
*p*All the *person_mentioned*Spanish inhabitants*/person_mentioned* left here *date_mentioned n="08-22-1832">this morning*/date_mentioned* for *location_mentioned*Bexar*/location_mentioned*. I met *person_mentioned*Col Ruiz*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*two miles from this place*/location_mentioned* quite sick, he requested me to write to you about his situation, of being sick and not having help enough to move on conveniently, that it was out of his power to go to *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*in haste as you requested. Three days since a small party of *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*came here brought the horse saddle and bridle that was taken from *person_mentioned*H Reed*/person_mentioned* when he was murdered they saw *person_mentioned*Reed*/person_mentioned*s hat and pantaloons they had a severe battle with the *person_mentioned*murderers*/person_mentioned* and killed five, they brought in the scalps of two. they say there is so much *person_mentioned*Indian */person_mentioned*sign above that they are afraid to hunt. The *person_mentioned*people */person_mentioned*here wish you to appoint a man to act as *person_mentioned*civil officer*/person_mentioned* for the present, untill things can be better regulated, herewith I send you the names of the men here, and account of election.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Francis Smith*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p* *p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Col Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San Felipe*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
